event.doc_name: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: In April 2025, the Department of Justice’s Office of Justice Programs abruptly and summarily terminated more than 370 multi-year cooperative agreements and grants awarding more than $820 million in essential funding.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In April 2025, the Department of Justice’s Office of Justice Programs abruptly and summarily terminated more than 370 multi-year cooperative agreements and grants awarding more than $820 million in essential funding.

evidence.text: OJP sent all Plaintiffs identical emails with the following boilerplate 'explanation' as to why the grants were being immediately terminated: 'These awards are being terminated because they 'no longer effectuate[] the program goals or agency priorities.'
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP terminated grants without prior notice or individualized explanations, using a boilerplate email stating awards 'no longer effectuate[] the program goals or agency priorities.'

evidence.text: Plaintiffs’ grant programs address a broad swath of community violence intervention and prevention projects, including initiatives designed to improve policing and prosecution, victims’ services, juvenile justice and child protection, substance use and mental health treatment...
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs' grant programs supported community violence intervention, including youth services, victim support, and specialized training (e.g., sign language interpretation for Deaf crime victims).

evidence.text: As a direct result of OJP’s terminations, CCYJ has had to end a project to build organizational and administrative capacity of CBOs to support sustainability of their CVI strategies and to reduce funding for a critical program in King County, Washington, which serves up to 200 youth annually...
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Termination caused immediate harm including layoffs, program cancellations, and loss of services to vulnerable populations (e.g., 200 youth losing access to violence intervention programs).

args.reason: All checklist items (Factual_Basis_of_Case) are fully extracted with four distinct values, each with verifiable evidence from the Class Action Complaint. No further documents need to be processed as the checklist is complete.

All checklist items (Factual_Basis_of_Case) are fully extracted with 4 distinct values, each supported by verifiable evidence from the Class Action Complaint. No gaps remain; no further documents need processing.
